roleset.name: to control or influence, governing, leading
roleset.note: GOVERN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'govern' based on WSJ. (from govern.01-v)
GOVERNANCE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, govern.01, WN sense #2. (from governance.01-n)

role.descr: specific domain, aspect of arg1 being governed

example.name: transitive
example.text: For years , a strict regimen governed the staff meetings at Nissan Motor Co. 's technical center in Tokyo 's western suburbs .
example.arg: the staff meetings at Nissan Motor Co. 's technical center in Tokyo 's western suburbs

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Such a policy implies that only a black politician can speak for a black person , and that only a white politician can govern on behalf of a white one .
example.arg: on behalf of a white one

example.name: passive
example.text: Study after study -- the most recent from the Brookings Institution -- tells us that the best schools are those that [*T*-1]-2 are free of outside interference and are governed [*-2]by a powerful head .

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: The G3 have the capacity to exert economic governance over ? financial markets but choose not to for reasons of ideology and economic interest.

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: Board members for the Morris Jeff Community School spent much of their Dec. 11 meeting shoring up ways they hope to strengthen their governance over the 275-student campus.
